Lowell Thomas at 14 years of age [photograph]
Lowell Thomas in grade school class photograph
Lowell Thomas in grade school class photograph [same as item 32]

Verso: L.T. 4th from right in second row [apparently incorrect-Lowell Thomas stands at the right directly in front of the principal]; between Nash Glau, no. 3, and Bill Post, no. 4. Cousin Carl T - no. 2, same row. Harold Worchester, 2nd from left in same row, became one of the leading mining engineers in West. Miss Elstine Connor, Teacher; Prof. Taylor, principal.

Verso: L.T. when he carried "samples" for the Portland Assay[?] Office. Perhaps Summer of 1907.
Lowell Thomas on horseback; unusual job; rode 9 hours a day for assay office. Many small mines. Carried samples. Returned next day with sad news [same as item 38] [photograph]
Verso: unusual job; rode 9 hours a day for assay office. Many small mines. Carried samples. Returned next day with sad news

Verso: In mining boots played on Rocks
Lowell Thomas poses with the Victor High School football team [Lowell Thomas in striped shirt, second from right in second row] [photograph]

Verso: 1908. Left to right:- Front row:- Don Kennedy, Marian Grice, Joe Brill, Middle row:- Andy George, Will Hayes, L.T., Don Black, Top row:- Len Hart, Rene Guerin; Prof ?; Craig, coach; Oren Devy, mgr.; next one don't remember; Charley Eby, "Midge" Frybeger.
Lowell Thomas poses with the Victor High School football team [Lowell Thomas in striped shirt, second from right in second row] [photograph]
Verso: Victor H.S. football team - 1906. L.T. (leaning) quarterback; H.S. Age 16 1906 end�
Lowell Thomas with fraternity brothers at Valparaiso University [photograph]

Lowell Thomas poses with two women; note: from left to right, Jeanette Barnes, Lowell Thomas and Marie Timmons. This picture was taken in 1911, the year Thomas graduated from the University of Northern Indiana (Valparaiso University) on the Kissing Bridge, which now spans Salt Creek and leads to Bridge VU Theatre [photograph]
Verso: 1st girl friends. L. of professors. U. of N. Indiana Valparaso "poor mans Harvard"

Note: Pictured above from left to right, Jeanette Barnes, Lowell Thomas, and Marie Timmons. This picture was taken in 1911, the year Thomas graduated from the University of Northern Indiana (Valparaiso University) on the Kissing Bridge, which now spans Salt Creek and leads to Bridge VU theater. Thomas will return on October 17 for Bridge VU Dedication.
Lowell Thomas poses with two men while at Valparaiso University; verso: 1910; Dr. [?] left, Preston Burtis on right [photograph]
Verso: [illegible] Preston Butis [?] on right
Lowell Thomas speaking to farmers while holding a map of Indiana; LT as map salesman in Indiana and Illinois, summer of 1910 [photograph]
Verso: LT as map salesman in Indiana and Illinois, summer of 1910

Verso: Lowell Thomas in his third floor study filled with [illegible] + souvenirs. He holds the tooth of an arctic Nar whale, sits in front of a portrait of Lawrence of Arabia (to whom he was attached as correspondant). At left are numerous copies of Thomas' own books. Above hangs a Burmese temple gong.
